list.name: Changes
list.comment: Added a new, customized word list and consolidated the program into only needing one, then did touch-ups on a few functions to match. (For example, part of fetch_list was redundant)

task.summary: Created the basis for the project: the ability to test words, based on an English frequency list. Testing is currently done in the console.

Fleshed out the basis for the testing (added grouping functionality- so we can examine different sections of the data as well as a function to find the average knowledge ranking of each of those frequency groups) and created a simple "Console Test" that I can use in development

Added a function to find the best fit line for the points based on the user's input (using robust LOWESS) and another function which graphs both the raw data and the smoothed line. This will allow for easier analysis of data from many different individuals (eventually)
Cleaned the word lists to remove all artifacts, such as numbers, and various other morphemes that don't fit this test's definition/application of "words"
Fixed an error I encountered where the test would overshoot the list. I added two fixes to get_word_at_index and fetch_list, then put a safeguard in test_words just for best practice
Added a new, customized word list and consolidated the program into only needing one, then did touch-ups on a few functions to match. (For example, part of fetch_list was redundant)
